item.title: Review of basic real analysis
item.description: Review of basic Real Analysis. Definition. (Compactness) A set $K \subseteq \mathbf{R}$ is compact if every sequence in $K$ has a subsequence that converges to a limit that is also in $K$. Theorem. (Characterization of Compactness) A set $K \subseteq \mathbf{R}$ is compact if and only if it is closed and bounded. Proof. $\Longrightarrow$ direction. We are given that $K$ is compact. We first prove the boundedness of $K$.
